intro: Friedlandia stachyoides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the stems are erect and branching. Friedlandia stachyoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
